member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.BooleanToVisibilityConverter
member.summary: Value converter that translates true to and false to .

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayerLocalSample
member.summary: Demonstrates creating an ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayer which references a LocalMapService.
member.title: ArcGIS Local Dynamic Map Service Layer

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayerLocalSample.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayerSample
member.summary: Demonstrates adding an ArcGIS dynamic map service layer to a Map in XAML.
member.title: ArcGIS Dynamic Map Service Layer

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ImageServiceRasterFunctions
member.summary: Demonstrates applying raster functions to an image service layer.
member.title: Image Service Raster Functions

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ArcGISImageServiceLayerSample
member.summary: Demonstrates adding an ArcGIS image service layer to a Map in XAML.
member.title: ArcGIS Image Service Layer

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.DynamicLayers.DynamicLayerAddData
member.summary: This sample demonstrates the dynamic layers capability to add Shapefiles and Raster datasets to the map. Single or multiple Shapefiles or Rasters can be selected in the open file dialog from within a folder. These files will be added to a local map service via the dynamic layers capability available in the API. This local map service is then used as the basis for an ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayer which is added to the map. It would be possible to extend the sample to allows users to specify the symbol/renderer for any shapefiles added. Raster symbology is predetermined by the raster itself.
member.title: Dynamic Layer Add Data

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.DynamicLayers.DynamicLayerLabeling
member.summary: This sample demonstrates dynamic layer labeling. Labels are configured in the LayerDrawingOptions of the dyanmic layer. In this sample, labels are shown for major and minor US cities with different fonts and scale ranges. Major city label info is configured in the XAML while minor city label info is added via the code-behind.
member.title: Dynamic Layer Labeling

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.DynamicLayers.DynamicLayerRendering
member.summary:
This sample demonstrates using the GenerateRendererTask to create a class breaks or unique value renderer on the server without having to retrieve all the data to the client. To use the sample, click either the Generate Range Values or Generate Unique Values button. This updates the renderer on the map.
In the code-behind, a GenerateRendererTask is used to create a renderer, and the LayerDrawingOptions.Renderer is set to the generated renderer for use in the map's display.
member.title: Dynamic Layer Rendering

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.DynamicLayers.DynamicLayerReordering
member.summary: This sample demonstrates changing the order of dynamic layers. Clicking the 'Change Layer Order' button uses the DynamicLayerInfoCollection to move the top layer to the bottom.
member.title: Dynamic Layer Reordering

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.DynamicLayers.WMSLayer
member.summary: This sample demonstrates displaying an WMSLayer draped over an ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer. The WMSLayer allows users to display Open GIS Consortium (OGC) WMS layers.
member.title: WMS Layer

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.EditAttachment
member.summary: Demonstrates how to update feature attachments in feature layer.
member.title: Edit Attachment

member.summary: Demonstrates how to selectively import and update feature attributes in dynamic layer.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SOEElevationData
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to use a custom Server Object Extension (SOE) hosted by ArcGIS for Server. The SOE operation used in this example returns a set of interpolated elevation values for a user defined grid. The grid extent and number of rows and columns are provided as inputs to the SOE.
member.title: SOE Elevation Data

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SOEElevationData.#ctor
member.summary: Construct SOE Elevation Data sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.FeatureLayerFromLocalGeodatabase
member.summary: This sample shows how to add a FeatureLayer from a local .geodatabase file to the map. A .geodatabase file may be created using the 'Create Runtime Content' tool in ArcMap.
member.title: Feature Layer from Local Geodatabase

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.FeatureLayerFromService
member.summary: This sample demonstrates the Feature Layer. Feature layers allow you to easily plot layers from a feature service on a map. As the sample XAML shows, this simply requires declaring a FeatureLayer element in the Map's layers collection and specifying the URL of the its ServiceFeatureTable attribute to the feature service layer.
member.title: Feature Layer From Service

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.FeatureLayerFromShapefile
member.summary: This sample shows how to add a FeatureLayer from a local shapefile to the map.
member.title: Feature Layer from Shapefile

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.FeatureLayerHitTesting
member.summary: This sample demonstates feature layer hit testing. When the user clicks on the map, the applicaiton uses FeatureLayer.HitTest to retrieve the feature at the mouse point. The HitTest method returns the row ID of the first feature found at the given point. This sample then uses the FeatureTable.QueryAsync method to retrieve a Feature for the HitTested row ID and desiplays its attributes in the UI.
member.title: Hit Testing

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.FeatureLayerHitTesting.MyMapView_MapViewTapped(System.Object,Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Controls.MapViewInputEventArgs)
member.summary: On each mouse click: - HitTest the feature layer - Query the feature table for the returned row - Set the result feature for the UI

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.FeatureLayerMapTips
member.summary: This sample shows how to display a map tip for a feature layer. In this example, the MouseMove event of the MapView is handled with code that performs a FeatureLayer HitTest / Query combination which returns a single feature for display in the mapTip element defined in the XAML.
member.title: Map Tips

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.FeatureLayerSelection
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to select and unselect features in a feature layer using the SelectFeatures, UnSelectFeatures and ClearSelecteion methods of the FeatureLayer class. The sample uses the MapView.RequestShapeAsync method to allow the user to draw a selection rectangle intersecting features that he would like to manage. Once the selection rectangle is returned, a SpatialQueryFilter is used to spatially select features in the feature layer using FeatureLayer.QueryAsync. When the features are identified the selected features list of the feature layer is managed using the FeatureLayer selection management methods.
member.title: Feature Layer Selection

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.FeatureLayerSelection.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Feature Layer Selection sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.QueryFilterSample
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to apply a filter to a feature layer using the FeatureLayer.Where property and to further filter the result set using a QueryFilter. The FeatureLayer.Where property allows you to retrieve a subset of records from a feature service that match an attribute query. The ArcGISFeatureTable.QueryAsync method takes a QueryFilter object and uses it to filter the current feature set. In this example, the features returned by the query are converted to graphics and displayed in a GraphicsOverlay on the map.
member.title: Query Filter

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.FindPlace
member.summary: Demonstrates how to use the FindAsync method of an OnlineLocatorTask object to find places by name.
member.title: Find a Place

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GeocodeAddress
member.summary: Demonstrates how to geocode an address using the OnlineLocatorTask.
member.title: Geocode an Address

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ReverseGeocode
member.summary: Demonstrates using the OnlineLocatorTask.ReverseGeocodeAsync method to get address information from a location on the map.
member.title: Reverse Geocode

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.AreaSample
member.summary: Demonstrates how to calculate the area and perimiter of a polygon using the GeometryEngine.
member.title: Area

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Boundary
member.summary: Demonstrates the GeometryEngine.Boundary method to calculate the geometric boundary of a given geometry. Here, boundaries are calculated for a multi-part polygon (returning a boundary polyline) and a multi-part polyline (returning multiple points).
member.title: Boundary

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.BufferSample
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the GeometryEngine to calculate a buffer. To use the sample, click a point on the map. The click point and a buffer of 5 miles around the point will be shown.
member.title: Buffer

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ClipGeometry
member.summary: Example of using the GeometryEngine.Clip method to clip feature geometries with a given envelope. To use this sample, the user draws a clipping rectangle over the feature polygons and the system then clips the intersecting feature geometries and displays the resulting polygons in a graphics layer on the map.
member.title: Clip

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ConvexHull
member.summary: Demonstrates use of the GeometryEngine.ConvexHull method to create a convex hull polygon for three or more points. A convex hull is the smallest polygon that completely encases a set (i.e. locus) of points. To use the sample, add three or more points on the map and click the Generate Convex Hull button. A polygon containing all the points entered will be returned.
member.title: Convex Hull

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.CreatePoints
member.summary: Demonstrates how to create point geometries, attach them to graphics and display them on the map. MapPoint geometry objects are used to store geographic points.
member.title: Create Points

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.CreatePolygons
member.summary: Demonstrates how to create polygon geometries, attach them to graphics and display them on the map. Polygon geometry objects are used to store geographic polygons.
member.title: Create Polygons

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.CreatePolylines
member.summary: Demonstrates how to create polyline geometries, attach them to graphics and display them on the map. Polyline geometry objects are used to store geographic lines.
member.title: Create Polylines

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.CutGeometry
member.summary: Example of using the GeometryEngine.Cut method to cut feature geometries with a given polyline. To use this sample, the user draws a cut polyline intersecting the feature polygons and the system then cuts the intersecting feature geometries and displays the resulting polygons in a graphics overlay on the map.
member.title: Cut

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Densify
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using GeometryEngine.Densify to take an input polygon and return a densified polygon. Original vertices to create the original polygon are shown in red. The returned polygon shows the additional densified vertices in green. To use the sample, click the 'Densify Polygon' button and create a polygon on the map. Double-click to end the polygon sketch and densify the polygon and see the original and densified vertices.
member.title: Densify

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Difference
member.summary: Example of using the GeometryEngine.Difference or GeometryEngine.SymmetricDifference methods to calculate the geometric difference between feature geometries and a user defined geometry. To use this sample, the user draws a polygon over the feature polygons and the system then calculates the difference between the intersecting feature geometries and displays the resulting polygons in a graphics layer on the map.
member.title: Difference

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.DistanceFromGeometry
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using the GeometryEngine.DistanceFromGeometry method to calcualte the linear distance of the shortest length between two geometries. To use the sample, click on the 'Caluclate Distance' button and then add a polyline and a point to the map. After the point is entered the shortest distance between them is displayed.
member.title: Distance From Geometry

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.DistanceFromGeometry.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Distance From Geometry sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Generalize
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using the GeometryEngine.Generalize method to take a polyline with numerous vertices and return a generalized polyline with less vertices. Additionally a SliderControl appears after the GeometryService completes that allows adjusting the maximum offset value of the generalized polyline.
member.title: Generalize

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GeodesicBuffer
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the GeometryEngine to calculate a geodesic buffer. To use the sample, click a point on the map. The click point and a geodesic buffer of 500 miles around the point will be shown.
member.title: Geodesic Buffer

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GeodesicDensify
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using GeometryEngine.GeodesicDensify to take an input shape and return a geodesic densified shape. Original vertices to create the original polygon or polyline are shown in red. The returned polygon shows the additional densified vertices in green. To use the sample, click the 'Densify' button and create a shape on the map. Double-click to end the polygon sketch and densify the shape and see the original and densified vertices.
member.title: Geodesic Densify

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GeodesicEllipse
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the GeometryEngine.GeodesicEllipse to calculate a geodesic ellipse. Also shows is how to calculate a geodesic sector using GeometryEngine.GeodesicSector to create a gedesic sector emanating from point. To use the sample, fill in the ellipse properties and click the 'Geodesic Ellipse' button, then click a center point on the map. The click point and a geodesic ellipse and sector centered at the point will be displayed.
member.title: Geodesic Ellipse

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GeodesicMove
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the GeometryEngine.GeodesicMove method to move a geometry be a specified distance. To use the sample, first digitize a polygon on the map. Then set the move distance and angle properties and click the 'Geodesic Move' button. The original polygon and the new moved polygon will be displayed.
member.title: Geodesic Move

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Intersection
member.summary: Example of using the GeometryEngine.Intersection method to intersect feature geometries with a given polygon. To use this sample, the user draws a polygon over the feature polygons and the system then retrieves the intersection of the feature geometries and the new polygon. Resulting polygons are shown in a graphics layer on the map.
member.title: Intersection

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.LabelPoint
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the GeometryEngine.LabelPoint method to calculate the location of label points.
member.title: Label Point

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.NearestCoordinateInGeometry
member.summary: Demonstrates how to find the nearest polygon point or vertex of a geometry using the NearestCoordinateInGeometry or NearestVertexInGeometry methods of the GeometryEngine class. Here, the user selects a target polygon graphic and then clicks points on the map to show the nearest point or vertex on the target polygon.
member.title: Nearest Coordinate in Geometry

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Offset
member.summary: Demonstrates how to create an offset geometry using the Offset method of the GeometryEngine class.
member.title: Offset

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ProjectCoordinate
member.summary: Sample shows how to project a coordinate from the current map projection (in this case Web Mercator) to a different projection.
member.title: Project

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Relate
member.summary: Sample shows how to use the GeometryEngine.Relate method to test the spatial relationship of two geometries.
member.title: Relate

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Relationship
member.summary: Sample shows how to to test the spatial relationship of two geometries.
member.title: Relationship

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Simplify
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the GeometryEngine.Simplify method to simplify a polygon, and demonstrates the importance of simplification. To use the sample, click the Query with Original Polygon button. Observe the results include parcels that are not wholly within the red polygon. Then click the Simplify Polygon, then Query button. Observe the resulting parcels are now wholly within the red polygon.
member.title: Simplify

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.UnionGeometry
member.summary: Example of using the GeometryEngine.Union method to calculate the geometric union of feature geometries and a given polygon. To use this sample, the user draws a polygon over the feature polygons and the system then retrieves the union of the feature geometries and the new polygon. Resulting polygons are shown in a graphics overlay on the map.
member.title: Union

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ClipFeatures
member.summary: Demonstrates use of the Geoprocessor to call an asynchronous Clip Features geoprocessing service.
member.title: Clip Features

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.DriveTimes
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the Geoprocessor to call a DriveTimes geoprocessing service. To use the sample, click a point in the map. Drive time polygons of 1, 2, and 3 minutes will be calculated and displayed on the map.
member.title: Drive Times

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ExtractData
member.summary: This sample shows how to work with an asynchronous Extract Data geoprocessing service. The Extract Data Task lets users specify an area of interest then download a zip file that contains data for that area from one or more layers.
member.title: Extract Data

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.MessageInABottle
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the Geoprocessor to call a MessageInABottle geoprocessing service. To use the sample, specify the number of days and click a point in the ocean. The path of a bottle dropped at the click point over the specified number of days will be drawn on the map.
member.title: Message in a Bottle

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.MessageInABottle.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Message In A Bottle sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.PopulationForArea
member.summary: This sample uses a geoprocessing task to estimate the number of people within a polygon you draw on the map. Click 'Summarize Population', then freehand a line on the map surrounding an area to analyze. When you release the mouse button, the polygon will auto-complete and you'll see how many people are estimated to live within the polygon boundaries.
member.title: Population for an Area

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.PopulationForArea.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Populattion for Area sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Viewshed
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the Geoprocessor to call a Viewshed geoprocessing service.
member.title: Viewshed

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.MovePoints
member.summary: Demonstrates one method of moving graphic points on the map.
member.title: Move Points

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.AddInteractively
member.summary: Example of how to add Graphics to a GraphicsOverlay by drawing shapes on the map. The Editor.RequestShapeAsync method is used to manage map drawing and geometry creation. Symbols for the graphics are defined in XAML.
member.title: Add Graphics Interactively

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.AddInteractively.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Add Graphics Interactively sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.CsvLayerSample
member.summary: Demonstrates defining a CsvLayer in XAML and setting the serviceUri property to a .csv file hosted online by the United States Geological Survey (USGS).
member.title: CSV Layer

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.CsvLayerSample.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GeoRssLayerSample
member.summary: Creates a GeoRssLayer based on the United States Geological Survey earthquake feed and assigned a SimpleRenderer.
member.title: GeoRSS Layer

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GeoRssLayerSample.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GraphicsLayerSelection
member.summary: This sample demonstrates GraphicLayer selection management. Graphics are set in a selected or unselected state by using the Graphic.IsSelected property. Here, the user selects or unselects graphics by clicking on the graphic.
member.title: Selection

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GraphicsLayerSelection.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Graphics Layer Selection sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GraphicsHitTesting
member.summary: This sample shows how to hit test a graphics layer using the GraphicsOverlay.HitTestAsync method. Here, the user may sketch a point on the map to initiate the hit testing process - the results of the hit test are then displayed in the UI.
member.title: Hit Testing

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GraphicsHitTesting.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Graphics Hit Testing sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GraphicsLayerRenderingMode
member.summary: This sample demonstates the use of the GraphicsLayer.RenderingMode property to control how a GraphicsOverlay draws its graphics. Zooming and Panning the map in each of the rendering modes will show the differences between them. Rendering mode differences will be more pronounced with higher numbers of graphics in the graphic layer.
member.title: Rendering Mode

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GraphicsLayerSample
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to add a GraphicsOverlay with Graphics and Symbols to the map in XAML. The sample also shows how to add Polyline graphics to a GraphicsOverlay from the code-behind.
member.title: Graphics Layer

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GraphicsMapTips
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to position map tips on graphics in a graphics layer. In this example, a random set of graphics is added to a graphics layer on the map and the MapView.MouseMove event is handled to hit test the graphics layer and position the map tip.
member.title: Map Tips

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GraphicsMapTips.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Graphics Map Tips sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GraphicsSourceSample
member.summary: This sample demonstartes the use of the GraphicsLayer.GraphicsSouce property. Here, three separate graphics source lists are initially created with random graphics. A button is used to switch the GraphicsSource property of the GraphicsLayer between the sources.
member.title: Graphics Source

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SmoothGraphicAnimation
member.summary: Animates a graphic smoothly between two user defined locations by moving MapPoint at regular intervals as defined by a DispatcherTimer. The distance the point is moved each time is calculated by a quintic easing function.
member.title: Smooth Graphic Animation

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SmoothGraphicAnimation.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ComputeClassStatistics
member.summary: Demonstrates how to compute class statistics for an image layer and display the results with the Maximum Likelihood Classification renderer rule.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GetSamples
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using an QueryTask to Query an ArcGISImageServiceLayer to find the outlines of image tiles and display them in a GraphicOverlay. MapOverlay attribute information is displayed for selected tile graphics when they are clicked on the map.
member.title: Get Samples

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GetSamples.#ctor

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Mensuration
member.summary: This sample demonstrates the use of the mensuration (measure) operations on an ArcGIS image service. Choose a measure operation and units to be returned in the results.
member.title: Mensuration

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.InteractionOptionsSample
member.summary: This sample shows how to change interaction settings that controls the MapView.
member.title: Interaction Options

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GroupLayers
member.summary: This sample demonstrates the use of GroupLayers to contain related layers in a map. In this sample there are two GroupLayers, one containing two basemap layers and the other containing four dynamic or feature layers. The legend shows how Layer properties (like IsVisible and Opacity) of layers within a GroupLayer can be managed either individually or as a part of the group.
member.title: Group Layers

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.LayerList
member.summary: Shows how to access layers in the map.
member.title: Layer List

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SetInitialCenterAndScale
member.summary: Shows how to set the initial center and scale of the map (Map.InitialViewpoint).
member.title: Set Initial Center and Scale

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SetInitialMapExtent
member.summary: Shows how to set the initial extent of the map (Map.InitialViewpoint).

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.LayersInitialized
member.summary: Demonstrates implementing logic which is dependent on the layer collection being initialized.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.LocationDisplay
member.summary: This sample demonstrates the location display using the MapView.LocationDisplay attribute to show your location on a map. The user may change Location Provider settings and view basic details about the current location.
member.title: Location Display

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.LocationDisplay.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Location Display sample user control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.RandomProvider
member.summary: Location provider that provides psuedo random location updates

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.MapGrid
member.summary: This sample shows how to enable a map grid using the MapView.MapGrid property. The user is allowed to switch between the standard grid types (Latitude / Longitude, MGRS, UTM, and USNG) by using a combobox in the upper right corner of the screen.
member.title: Map Grid

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.MapOverlays
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to display map overlay elements in the MapView. Here, three map overlays are included in the MapView XAML. The first is an overlay that maintains a constant X,Y anchor point on the map. The second overlay is always anchored to the center point of the current extent. The last overlay changes its anchor point when the user clicks the map.
member.title: Map Overlays

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.MapRotation
member.summary: This sample shows how to rotate a map using the MapView.Rotation property. The slider control in the top right corner of the map controls the rotation angle of the map view.
member.title: Map Rotation

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.OverviewMap
member.summary: This sample demonstrates displaying an overview map to indicate the extent of the parent map.
member.title: Overview Map

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SetSpatialReference
member.summary: Demonstrates setting the extent and spatial reference of a map via the Map.InitialExtent property.
member.title: Set Spatial Reference

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ShowMapExtent
member.summary: This sample includes a Map and a ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer and demonstrates how to handle the ExtentChanged event on the MapView. The extent parameters of the map are displayed in a textblock as they change at runtime. Since the Map is in wrap-around mode, absolute values represent the map extent on an infinite continuous grid where values on the X axis increase or decrease as you pan. Normalized values represent the map extent in the real-world and take the dateline (or current central meridian) into account.
member.title: Show Map Extent

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ShowMapScale
member.summary: This sample demonstrates the map scale changing when you zoom in and out. The XAML textblock is bound to the MapView.Scale property to display the current map scale at the bottom of the display.
member.title: Show Map Scale

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ShowMouseCoordinates
member.summary: This sample includes a Map and a single ArcGIS Server layer. MouseMove events on the Map are handled to return the mouse cursor location over the map. The location is displayed in pixels and map units.
member.title: Show Mouse Coordinates

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SwipeMap
member.summary: Shows how to swipe one map over another.
member.title: Swipe

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SwitchBasemaps
member.summary: Demonstrates changing the basemap layer in a map by switching between ArcGIS tiled map services layers hosted by ArcGIS Online.
member.title: Switch Basemaps

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ExportTileCache
member.summary: Demonstrates how to download a local tile cache from an online service with the ExportTiles operation enabled.
member.title: Export Tile Cache

member.summary: Construct Export Tile Cache sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GenerateGeodatabase
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to generate and download a local geodatabase from an online map service for later offline use.
member.title: Generate Geodatabase

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.OfflineGeocoding
member.summary: Demonstrates performing a geocode by submitting values for multiple address fields to a local locator.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.OfflineRouting
member.summary: This sample demonstrates offline routing with a network analyst LocalRouteTask.

member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to synchronize a local geodatabase with an online service.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.OAuthAuthorizeHandler
member.summary: Desktop OAuthAuthorize handler which encapsulates the redirection of the user to the OAuth authorization URI by using a WebBrowser.

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.OAuthAuthorizeHandler.AuthorizeAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Redirects the user to the authorization URI by using a WebBrowser.
member.returns: Dictionary of parameters returned by the authorization URI (code, access_token, refresh_token, ...)

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.OAuthAuthorizeHandler.DecodeParameters(System.Uri)
member.summary: Decodes the parameters returned when the user agent is redirected to the callback url The parameters can be returned as fragments (e.g. access_token for Browser based app) or as query parameter (e.g. code for Server based app)

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.PortalSecurity
member.summary: Security class that defines global challenge method for accessing arcgis.com portal services

member.summary: This sample shows how to add the ArcGIS Traffic service to a map.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.BatchGeocoding
member.summary: This sample shows how to perform batch geocoding using the ArcGIS Online World Geocoding service with an ArcGIS Online Organizational account.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SourceAddress
member.summary: Souce Address class with change notification for UI

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.CreateWebMap
member.summary: This sample shows how to create a new webmap from scratch by adding a BaseMap and OperationLayers. Here, a webmap object is created with a base map and operationlayers including an ArcGISDynamicMapService layer, a FeatureService with Popups and a FeatureCollection.
member.title: Create Web Map

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.LoadWebMap
member.summary: This sample demonstrates adding data a WebMap from ArcGIS Online to an application.
member.title: Load WebMap

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.LoadWebMapMVVM
member.summary: This sample demonstrates adding data a WebMap from ArcGIS Online to an application using the MVVM design pattern.
member.title: Load WebMap MVVM

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.PortalBasemaps
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to search for, return, and dynamically use basemaps from ArcGIS Online.
member.title: Basemaps

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.PortalSearch
member.summary: This sample shows how to use the Portal API to search for webmaps on ArcGIS.com that match the search critera.
member.title: Search

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ShowProperties
member.summary: This sample illustrates a simple way of querying the Portal metadata/properties and retrieving featuredItems using the Portal API.
member.title: Show Properties

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ShowProperties.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Show Portal Properties sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ClientPrinting
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to print a map using client-side capabilities of the PrintDialog class.
member.title: Client Printing

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.PreviewSize
member.summary: Represents a Preview Size (creatable in XAML)

member.name: P:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.PreviewSize.Id
member.summary: ID or Name of the previes size

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ServerPrinting
member.summary: This sample demonstrates printing a map using a PrintTask. To use the sample, specify the print settings (Layout Template and Format) using the dropdowns and click the Export Map button to generate a printout of the map. The printout will be displayed using the systems default browser.
member.title: Server Printing

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.AttributeQuery
member.summary: This sample demonstrates performing an attribute query, adding the results to the map and UI, and zooming to the resulting geometry. To use the sample, select a state from the drop-down menu. A QueryTask is used to query a map service layer based on the selected state name. The result is then added as a Graphic to the map and the attributes displayed in a list control.
member.title: Attribute Query

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.FindTaskSample
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to search your data using the find task. The sample displays the results on the map and in tabular list view.
member.title: Find

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.IdentifySample
member.summary: This sample demonstrates performing identify operations. To use the sample, click anywhere in the United States to identify features. The results will be shown in the combo box and list view on the right side of the application. View the data for different results by selecting them from the combo box. In the code-behind, an IdentifyTask is used to perform the identify operation. The tasks IdentifyParameters specify to query the geometry of the map click and to query all the layers in the target map service, which enables returning results from multiple layers.
member.title: Identify

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.QueryRelatedTables
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to use a relationship query to display information from a related table for selected features. Clicking on the map highlight a set of wells near the clicked point. Select a well from the list to display related features (tops). The object id of the well is used in the relationship query to return 0 to many related records displayed in the list view. Note that the code requires a relationshipId. Feature layers can have more than one relationship and each relationship is identified by a unique identifier. You can use the Services Directory to find the relationship id.
member.title: Query Related Tables

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SpatialQuery
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to spatially search your data using a QueryTask with its geometry attribute set. The sample spatially queries a map service using the buffer geometry around a user's click point and displays the results in a graphics layer on the map.
member.title: Spatial Query

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Statistics
member.summary: Demonstrates how to use a QueryTask to get statistics from a map service. A statistics query is executed against a US states map service that gets statistics about population in sub-regions. This is combined with another query that retrieves all state features and the result is added to a graphicslayer and a tabular list view.
member.title: Statistics

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Routing
member.summary: Demonstrates simple point to point routing between two input locations with either OnlineLocatorTask or LocalLocatorTask.
member.title: Routing

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.RoutingWithBarriers
member.summary: Shows routing and re-routing between stops and around user defined barriers using the OnlineLocatorTask.
member.title: Routing Around Barriers

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.RoutingWithDirections
member.summary: Demonstrates retrieving a route and driving directions between input locations with OnlineLocatorTask.
member.title: Routing with Directions

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.TokenSecuredServices
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to use the IdentityManager to gain access to a secured service. Here, the map contains a public basemap and a secure dynamic layer. The IdentityManager will challenge for credentials when the Map tries to access a secure service.
member.title: ArcGIS Token Secured Services

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.TokenSecuredServices.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Token Secured Services sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Symbology.Specialized.MessageProcessingSample
member.summary: Sample shows how to read and process Mil2525C message data from XML file.
member.title: Message Processor

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Symbology.Specialized.SymbolDictionarySearchSample
member.summary: Sample shows how to use search the Mil2525C symbol dictionary.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Symbology.Hydrographic.S57CellInfoSample
member.summary: This sample demonstrates adding and removing S-57 cells from an HydrographicS57Layer in the Map and accessing the Dataset Identification (DSID) metadata of those S-57 cells. The DSID metadata Provides information regarding the dataset's source and the product specification it is part of.
member.title: S57 Cell Information

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Symbology.Hydrographic.S57DisplayPropertiesSample
member.summary: This sample demonstrates using the global static HydrographicS52DisplayProperties object to control the display properties of an HydrographicS57Layer, such as the Color Scheme or Safety Contour Depth.
member.title: S57 Display Properties

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Symbology.Hydrographic.S57IdentifySample
member.summary: This sample demostrates how to perform a point-based identify style operation on an HydrographicS57Layer using the SearchLayer method.
member.title: S57 Identify

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.Symbology.Hydrographic.S57SearchSample
member.summary: This sample shows how to use the the SearchAsync method to search an HydrographicS57Layer based on an input geometry, buffer value and object name.
member.title: S57 Search

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.ClassBreaksRendererSample
member.summary: Sample shows how to create a ClassBreaksRenderer for a graphics layer. Earthquake data points are pulled from an online source and rendered using the GraphicsLayer ClassBreaksRenderer.
member.title: Class Breaks Renderer

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.GenerateRenderer
member.summary: This sample uses an ArcGIS Server Task to generate a Class Breaks Renderer with five classes. Note that this functionality requires an ArcGIS Server 10.1 instance. The generate renderer task can also generate unique value renderers and can also generate color ramp(s) from two or more colors.
member.title: Generate Renderer Task

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntimeSDKDotNet_DesktopSamples.Samples.SimpleRendererSample
member.summary: Sample shows how to create a SimpleRenderer for a graphics layer in XAML and code. User added points will be added to the graphics layer and rendered using the GraphicsLayer Renderer.
